geeklist.title: Segregation in Carcassonne!
geeklist.description: You've mixed all your Carcassonne expansions together for the massive, every-expansion game. Now you want to separate them to try a simple mix of no expansions, or only one with the original. How are you going to tackle this daunting task? Easy! Look at the photos in this inventory, and parse the tiles appropriately. (I recommend focusing on the expansions, and letting the original Carcassonne's 72 tiles remain as the distillate.)

item.body: 2000 [b]Carcassonne[/b] 72 land tiles (1 of which is a starting tile with a darker back) 8 followers × 5 colors (blue, yellow, green, red, black) 1 scoring track
2001 [b]Carcassonne: The River[/b] 12 river tiles

2002 [b]Carcassonne: Inns & Cathedrals[/b] (FKA [b]The Expansion[/b]) 18 land tiles 8 followers (grey) 6 large followers × 6 colors (blue, yellow, green, red, black, grey) 6 50/100 point scoring track lap tiles

2003 [b]Carcassonne: Traders & Builders[/b] 24 land tiles (20 have goods on them, which are rather conspicuous) 20 trade good tokens (9 wine, 6 grain, 5 cloth) 1 pig × 6 colors (blue, yellow, green, red, black, grey) 1 builder × 6 colors (blue, yellow, green, red, black, grey) 1 cloth bag [It's about time!!]
2003 [b]Carcassonne: King[/b] & Scout 5 land tiles 1 king tile 1 robber baron tile
2004 [b]The Count of Carcassonne[/b] 12 city tiles (they fit together to form a city, and their backs are numbered 1-12) 1 count
2004 [b]Carcassonne: The Cathars[/b] - [wikipage=Spielbox] insert 4 land tiles (each has a monk icon, in addition to the besieged city walls)

2005 [b]Carcassonne: The Princess & The Dragon[/b] 30 land tiles (each tile has either a volcano (with a cute little dragon), a dragon icon, a princess icon, or a magic gateway on it - only The River II has another volcano, but there's river on the tile, so it's pretty easy to identify) 1 dragon 1 fairy
2005 [b]Carcassonne: The River II[/b] 12 river tiles
2006 [b]Carcassonne: The Tower[/b] 18 tower tiles (each tile has a tower foundation on it) 30 tower segments
2006 [b]Mini Expansion[/b] in Games Quarterly Magazine, Issue 11 12 land tiles

2007 [b]Carcassonne: Abbey & Mayor[/b] 12 land tiles (They have translucent barn icons on them) 6 abbey tiles 1 wagon × 6 colors (blue, yellow, green, red, black, grey) 1 mayor × 6 colors (blue, yellow, green, red, black, grey) 1 barn × 6 colors (blue, yellow, green, red, black, grey)

2008 [b]Carcassonne: The Cult[/b] 5 land tiles (in [gameid=33458] they have a crown icon; in the [i]Hans im Glück Almanach 2008[/i] they have a pentagon icon; in [gameid=35666] they have no icon, and there's a sixth tile)
2008 [b]Carcassonne: Cult, Siege & Creativity[/b] 6 Cult tiles (each has a big mound in the center) 4 Siege tiles (similar to [thing=13300][/thing]) 2 Creativity tiles (blank white)

2008 [b]Carcassonne: The Catapult[/b] 12 land tiles (each bears a catapult icon, as well as depicting a fair with a catapult) catapult measuring board 4 catapult tokens × 6 colors (blue, yellow, green, red, black, grey)

2009 [b]Carcassonne: Wheel of Fortune[/b] [imageid=512984 inline][imageid=512985 inline][imageid=512986 inline][imageid=512987 inline][imageid=512988 inline][imageid=512989 inline] 72 tiles bearing a wheel icon, comprising the following: [c] [/c]63 tiles released in [thing=822][/thing] [c] [/c]6 from [thing=2993]Inns & Cathedrals[/thing] [c] [/c]1 from [thing=5405]Traders & Builders[/thing] [c] [/c]2 from [thing=7707]King & Scout[/thing]. 1 4×4 wheel of fortune start tile
2009 [b]Carcassonne: The Tunnel[/b] 4 land tiles (each bears a pentagon icon and depicts 2 or 3 fancy archways as tunnel entrances) 2 tunnel chips × 6 colors (blue, yellow, green, red, black, grey)
2010 [b]Carcassonne: Crop Circles[/b] 6 land tiles (each has a wheat icon, and a prominent grain field with a "crop circle" on the tile)
2010 [b]Carcassonne: Bridges, Castles, and Bazaars[/b] 12 landscape tiles (with a bridge icon) 12 castle tiles (oddly shaped) 12 wooden bridges
10 Festival land tiles
